result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian M Sawall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is to serve ninety (90) days in the Walworth County Jail with Huber privileges to commence on or before November 28, 2022 @ 8:00 a.m. NOTE: The defendant is to report on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Failure to comply will result in revocation of Huber for a period of five (5) days unless reinstated by the Court. 
----------------------
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 
----------------------

Pay court costs. Court costs are paid in full.
----------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

Defendant Brian M Sawall in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Brian M Sawall.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:25 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing. Record by Atty. Lochowicz as to agreement. Court goes over maximum penalties and deportation warnings. Defendant responds to Court's questions regarding plea questionnaire. Atty. Lochowicz responds to Court's questions regarding entry of plea and stipulation to facts.
Defendant pleads GUILTY to Count #1 - remaining count(s) dismissed and read-in.
Court finds plea knowing, voluntary, intelligent.
Defendant does not make a statement.
Court adopts agreement of the parties - see attached plea agreement.
Court in recess.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Brian M Sawall not in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Brian M Sawall.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA JJ Crawford. Called @ 4:02 p.m. Appearances made. Matter was scheduled for plea and sentencing, but defendant misunderstood and thought today was to schedule the plea and sentencing. There is authorization on file.  Court resets the plea and sentencing. Court in recess.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduling order

Attorney J.J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian M Sawall not in court.  Attorney Keith Venema in court for Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz appears for Brian M Sawall.  
Formal reading of the complaint is waived, charges are explained. 
Not Guilty plea is entered by Attorney Venema. 
Scheduling Order to attorney via e-filing.

records.addlTxt: Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Brian M. Sawall in court. Prosecuting attorney J.J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. State needs more time to make charging decision. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
NOTICE OF ARREST
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH WALWORTH COUNTY FAIRGROUNDS. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
